mocafe.litforms.prostate_cancer

This module contains methods to build the weak form of a Phase Field prostate cancer model described by Lorenzo and collaborators [LST+16].

If you use this model in your research, remember to cite the original paper describing the model:

Lorenzo, G., Scott, M. A., Tew, K., Hughes, T. J. R., Zhang, Y. J., Liu, L., Vilanova, G., & Gomez, H. (2016). Tissue-scale, personalized modeling and simulation of prostate cancer growth. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences. https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.1615791113

For a complete description of the model, please refer to the original publication. Also, if you use this model for your scientific work, remember to cite the original paper.

mocafe.litforms.prostate_cancer.df_dphi(phi, chem_potential_constant)

Returns the derivative of the “chemical potential” associated with the cancer equation. It is used to build the weak form for the prostate cancer model.

Parameters

  • phi – the FEniCS Function for varphi

  • chem_potential_constant – the constant of the chemical potential (equals to 16 in [LST+16])

Returns

the derivative of the chemical potential, as FEniCS UFL equation

mocafe.litforms.prostate_cancer.prostate_cancer_chem_potential(var_phi: dolfin.cpp.common.Variable, chem_potential_constant)

Returns the “chemical potential” associated with the cancer equation. It is used to build the weak form for the prostate cancer model.

Parameters

  • var_phi – the varphi variable

  • chem_potential_constant – the constant of the chemical potential (equals to 16 in [LST+16])

Returns

the chemical potential, as FEniCS UFL equation

mocafe.litforms.prostate_cancer.prostate_cancer_form(phi: dolfin.function.function.Function, phi_prec: dolfin.function.function.Function, sigma: dolfin.function.function.Function, v: dolfin.function.argument.TestFunction, parameters: mocafe.fenut.parameters.Parameters)

Builds the FEniCS UFL weak form for the prostate cancer equation reported by Lorenzo and collaborators [LST+16]. The name of the variable for the cancer is varphi

The parameters required for the equation must be specified in the parameters object. The name for the required parameters ore:

  • dt: the time step (time discretization: backward Euler)

  • lambda: diffusion constant for varphi (correspond to lambda in the original paper)

  • tau: the time constant for the double-well potential (correspond to tau in the original paper)

  • chempot_constant: the double-well potential constant (no name in the original paper; its value was 16)

  • chi: proliferation rate for prostate cancer (correspond to chi in the original publication)

  • A: the apoptosis rate for the prostate cancer (correspond to \(A\) in the original publication

Parameters

  • phi – the FEniCS Function for varphi

  • phi_prec – the initial value for varphi

  • sigma – the FEniCS Function for the nutrients (sigma)

  • v – the Test Function to define the weak form

  • parameters – the parameters of the equation as Parameters object. All the values listed in the documentation must be present

Returns

the UFL weak form for the prostate cancer equation

mocafe.litforms.prostate_cancer.prostate_cancer_nutrient_form(sigma: dolfin.function.function.Function, sigma_old: dolfin.function.function.Function, phi: dolfin.function.function.Function, v: dolfin.function.argument.TestFunction, s: dolfin.function.function.Function, parameters: mocafe.fenut.parameters.Parameters)

Builds the FEniCS UFL weak form for the nutrient equation reported by Lorenzo and collaborators [LST+16]. The name of the nutrient is sigma.

The parameters required for the equation must be specified in the parameters object. The name for the required parameters ore:

  • dt: the time step (time discretization: backward Euler)

  • epsilon: diffusion constant for sigma (correspond to lambda in the original paper)

  • delta: the uptake rate of the nutrient by the cancer (correspond to delta in the original paper)

  • gamma: the decay rate for sigma (correspong to gamma in the original paper)

Parameters

  • sigma – the FEniCS Function for the sigma variable

  • sigma_old – the FEniCS Function for the initial value of the sigma value

  • phi – the FEniCS Function for the cancer

  • v – the Test Function to define the weak form

  • s – the FEniCS Function for the nutrient supply

  • parameters – the parameters fo the equation as Parameters object. All the values listed in the documentation must be present

Returns

the UFL weak form for the nutrient equation
